architectural_decisions.title: Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Use of Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide methods for CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Dependency Injection with FastAPI
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies effectively, such as the current user and payment processor.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling with FastAPI's HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios, ensuring proper responses and error messages.

architectural_decisions.title: Multi-Provider Payment Processing
architectural_decisions.rationale: To support multiple payment providers, enhancing flexibility and scalability.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Token-based Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: To securely authenticate users and enforce authorization policies.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Email Confirmation Notifications
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify users about order confirmations.

Create and Manage Orders.description: API endpoints for creating and managing orders in an e-commerce application.

steps.description: Create a new order by sending a POST request to /api/orders/create with a JSON body containing order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Retrieve order details using a GET request to /api/orders/{order_id}. Only accessible to the order owner.
List all orders for the current user using a GET request to /api/orders/. Supports pagination via limit and offset query parameters.
Cancel a pending order using a POST request to /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel. Orders in processing or shipped states cannot be cancelled.
